summary: Run an externally hosted UDF container
description:
Runs a compatible UDF container that is either externally hosted by a service provider or running on a local machine of the user. The UDF container must follow the [openEO UDF specification](https://openeo.org/documentation/1.0/udfs.html).

The referenced UDF service can be executed in several processes such as ``aggregate_spatial()``, ``apply()``, ``apply_dimension()`` and ``reduce_dimension()``. In this case an array is passed instead of a raster data cube. The user must ensure that the data is properly passed as an array so that the UDF can make sense of it.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The data to be passed to the UDF as array or raster data cube.

schema.title: Single Value
schema.description: A single value of any data type.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL to a remote UDF service.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Additional data such as configuration options that should be passed to the UDF.

returns.description:
The data processed by the UDF service.

* Returns a raster data cube, if a raster data cube is passed for `data`. Details on the dimensions and dimension properties (name, type, labels, reference system and resolution) depend on the UDF.
* If an array is passed for `data`, the returned value can be of any data type, but is exactly what the UDF returns.
